intro: Phaca agrestis, commonly known as the field phaca, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbel-like inflorescence. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its small white or greenish flowers bloom in late spring. Phaca agrestis is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
